page.title: 13Gt.Waldingfield School Field
page.content: The school stands on part of a large field which once was used for growing corn.The site was intended to house a police station and a health clinic as well as the school,but these were never built.There is a large pond near the school.This is fed by land drainage water and the high nitrogen content of the water has caused a large quantity of duck weed to grow.Since the school was fenced in,for protection,moorhens have nested on the pond.The field is used by the village football team,who have a pavilion.There is also an adventure playground with swings, slide and climbing frame.The field, except for the part where the school stands, is administered by the community council.
